gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Graph
Class GraphJPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container

                          gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Graph.GraphJPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class GraphJPanel
extends CoordJPanel
implements java.io.Serializable, IPreserveState

A GraphJPanel Test object maintains and draws a list of graphs.

See Also:
Serialized Form

LOG_SCALE_X

public static final java.lang.String LOG_SCALE_X
"log scale x" - This constant String is a key for referencing the State information about the logarithmic x axis for the GraphJPanel. This log scale is a boolean value to determine if the log axis is drawn for the x values.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LOG_SCALE_Y

public static final java.lang.String LOG_SCALE_Y
"log scale y" - This constant String is a key for referencing the State information about the logarithmic y axis for the GraphJPanel. This log scale is a boolean value to determine if the log axis is drawn for the y values.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GRAPH_DATA

public static final java.lang.String GRAPH_DATA
"Graph Data" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the Graph Data. Since the Graph Data has its own state, this value is of type ObjectState, and contains the state of the Graph Data.

getObjectState

public ObjectState getObjectState(boolean isDefault)
This method will get the current values of the state variables for this object. These variables will be wrapped in an ObjectState. Keys will be put in alphabetic order.

Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Overrides:
getObjectState in class CoordJPanel
Parameters:
isDefault - Should selective state be returned, that used to store user preferences common from project to project?
Returns:
if true, the default state containing user preferences, if false, the entire state, suitable for project specific saves.

setData

public void setData(float[] x_vals,
                    float[] y_vals)
Set the data for the "0th" graph to the specified x and y values. The bounds of the graph will be recalculated based on all graphs currently in this GraphJPanel object and the graphs will be redrawn. The graph will be drawn as a histogram, if there is one more x-value than y-values. If there are the same number of x and y values, the graph will be drawn using a simple line graph. This routine is included for compatibility with previous versions.

Parameters:
x_vals - array of floats for the x values of the graph
y_vals - array of floats for the y values of the graph.

setData

public boolean setData(float[] x_vals,
                       float[] y_vals,
                       int graph_num,
                       boolean redraw)
Set the data for the specified graph to the specified x and y values. The bounds of the graph will be recalculated based on all graphs currently in this GraphJPanel object and the graphs may be redrawn. A graph will be drawn as a histogram, if there is one more x-value than y-values. If there are the same number of x and y values, the graph will be drawn using a simple line graph.

Parameters:
x_vals - array of floats for the x values of the graph
y_vals - array of floats for the y values of the graph.
graph_num - the index of the graph to draw in the list of graphs. The index must be at least zero and no more than the number of graphs currently held in this GraphJPanel. If The index is less than the number of graphs currently held, the current graph with that index will be changed. If the index equals the number of graphs currently held, a new graph will be add to the list of graphs and filled out with the specified data. If the graph_num is not valid, this method has no effect and returns false.
redraw - if this is true, redraw all the graphs
Returns:
true if the graph_num is valid, false otherwise.

updatePointedAtGraph

public void updatePointedAtGraph(float[] x,
                                 float[] y)
Call this method to update the pointed at graph. This method is used in in place of setData() because it will not reset the bounds.

Parameters:
x - - X values of the graph.
y - - Y values of the graph.

clearData

public void clearData()
Remove all graphs and create a default simple graph consisting of a line joining (0,0) with (1,1).

setErrors

public boolean setErrors(float[] errors,
                         int error_loc,
                         int graph_num,
                         boolean redraw)
Set the errors for the specified graph.

Parameters:
errors - the array of error values
error_loc - the integer constant that tells where the error bars ar to be drawn.
graph_num - the index of the graph. The index must be at least zero and less than the number of graphs currently held in this GraphJPanel. If the graph_num is not valid, this method has no effect and returns false.
redraw - if this is true, redraw all the graphs
Returns:
true if the graph_num is valid, false otherwise.

redraw - if this is true, redraw all the graphs

setMultiplotOffsets

public void setMultiplotOffsets(int x_offset,
                                int y_offset)
Set the number of pixels that additional graphs are offset vertically and horizontally.

Parameters:
x_offset - the number of pixels that successive graphs are offset from each other in the x direction.
y_offset - the number of pixels that successive graphs are offset from each other in the y direction.

setRemoveHiddenLines

public void setRemoveHiddenLines(boolean hide)
Determines whether or not hidden lines are to be removed when multiple graphs are drawn. The graphs are draw from back to front. If hidden line removal has been enabled, the region under the graph is filled with the background color to erase any part of previous lines that would be visible under the next line.

Parameters:
hide - flag that indicates whether or not the hidden lines are removed.

getNum_graphs

public int getNum_graphs()
Get the number of graphs currently held by this GraphJPanel.

Returns:
the number of graphs currently held. This will always be at least 1, since it always maintains at least one default graph.

getY_value

public float getY_value(float x_value,
                        int graph_number)
Get the y value corresponding to the specified x_value on the spcified graph held by this GraphJPanel. If the graph_number is not valid, this returns Float.NaN. If the x_value is outside of the interval of x values for the graph, this returns 0. In other cases, the tablulated y values are interpolated to obtain an approximate y value at the specified x value.

Parameters:
x_value - the x value for which the corresponding y value is to be interpolated
graph_number - index for the graph whose value is to be interpolated
Returns:
interpolated y value at the specified x value, if the graph number and x value are valid.

setX_bounds

public void setX_bounds(float x_min,
                        float x_max)
Specify a range of x values to use for the graph. By default, the x range is automatically adjusted to the x range of the data.

Parameters:
x_min - The smallest x value to be drawn.
x_max - Yhe largest x value to be drawn.

autoX_bounds

public void autoX_bounds()
Set the x range fo the graph to the x range of data. This is the default behavior.

is_autoX_bounds

public boolean is_autoX_bounds()
Returns:
flag indicating whether or not the current X bounds have been automatically determined from the data x values.

setY_bounds

public void setY_bounds(float y_min,
                        float y_max)
Specify a range of y values to use for the graph. By default, the y range is automatically adjusted to the y range of the data.

Parameters:
y_min - The smallest y value to be drawn.
y_max - The largest y value to be drawn.

autoY_bounds

public void autoY_bounds()
Set the y range fo the graph to the y range of data. This is the default behavior.

is_autoY_bounds

public boolean is_autoY_bounds()
Returns:
flag indicating whether or not the current Y bounds have been automatically determined from the data y values.

Scale factor used to scale y-axis.
